alert.note: Alert for Santa Cruz (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 13 at 4:33PM MST until August 13 at 6:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Santa Cruz County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 615 PM MST. * At 433 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms earlier this afternoon produced between 1.00 and 2.50 inches of rain. The heaviest rainfall fell along and near Highway 82 between Nogales and Patagonia. Stream gages and webcams facing the Nogales Wash in Nogales indicated flash flooding was currently ongoing. This Flash Flood Warning extends the previous Flash Flood Warning for the same location. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Nogales, Rio Rico, Patagonia Lake State Park and Nogales International Airport. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
